person.note: Song(2) Qi(2) [1558] His ancestors were Guangping jun wangzu. Xiang's [8119] brother, Baoguo's [3799], Junguo's [3796], Fengguo's [7344], Huiguo's [3797], and Yanguo's [3809] father, Songnian's [3802], Yannian's [3810], and Yinian's [7345] grandfather. Huiguo's father-in-law was Jia(3) Changchao [8031]. Yanguo's father-in-law was Cheng(1) Kan [116]. His grandson or grandnephew Jingnian's [3794] father-in-law was Han(1) Zongdao [663] and his great grandson or great grandnephew, Sheng [3801], was Han(1) Zongdao's [663] grandson-in-law. His descendant, Gangzhong [3798], was the son-in-law of Xiang(2) Han [3355], the son of Xiang(2) Zimin's [714] brother, Zishao [3359]. Kangnian [1569] and Pengnian [1572] have the same generational name as his grandsons and grandnephews. Gangzhong's brother, Wenzhong [3807], took up the duties of Xingzai zamai wu zamai chang tixian guan in late 1194 and retired from the civil service in mid-1195. This branch of the lineage moved to Hengzhou, Hengyang xian during the Southern Song. Wenzhong and Gangzhong were a menren of Zhang(1) Chi [7164]. Zhao [1559] has the same generational name as Qi(2)'s and Xiang's [8119] great grandsons. Order of birth of sons in funerary inscription different from that in CBD. I follow funerary inscription. XCB, 145.16b, 189.8a; He Yi, Xingzai zamai wu . . ., 3a-3b; SHY:ZG, 27.46a; SS, 284.13b; Song Qi, WJ, 62.16a; Du Dagui, 'shang, 7.4a; Wang Anshi, WJ, 52.557; YLDD, 12428.4a. CBD, 1, 738-9.
